name: Ensure object containers (buckets) are not publicly writable
body:
P﻿ublicly writable buckets allow anyone to upload, modify, and/or delete data from your buckets. This can lead to data loss, malware spread, and increased costs.

I﻿f you indeed want to allow your users to upload objects to your buckets, you can either let your application handle it or you (your application) can generate signed URLs granting the permission for a certain action at a certain path:

#### AWS
* [Presigned URLs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/PresignedUrlUploadObject.html)

#### GCP
* [Signed URLs](https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/access-control/signed-urls)

#### Alibaba
* [Signed URLs](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/object-storage-service/latest/access-control-add-signatures-to-urls)
